What's On

Our carefully curated programme is designed to bring you exciting new theatre, laugh-out-loud comedy and a diverse range of live music acts.

10 Week Actor Training

workshops
11:05 Monday 10 May 2021

An introduction to actor training, this demanding course nurtures students through a life-changing journey, in which they are challenged to achieve their full potential as actors and acquire skills for working in the full range of acting contexts.

An introduction to actor training, this demanding course nurtures students through a life-changing journey, in which they are challenged to achieve their full potential as actors and acquire skills for working in the full range of acting contexts. The aim is to introduce the art of acting to adults (aged 18 and over) at a totally professional level. Run by seasoned professional actors and theatre directors. We will explore: ● Acting technique ● Voice training ● Movement training ● Improvisation ● Characterisation ● Script analysis ● Rehearsal technique ● Screen Acting The courses are prepared with the students in mind, and are designed to ensure that you gain as much as possible from the training you receive. 10th May - 19th July (one week break for half term) Please email us on info@printersplayhouse.co.uk to book your place. All events and workshops are in pre-booked ‘bubbles’ The course can be split into the three elements and attended and paid for separately. Voice and Text £200 Acting £200 Acting for Screen £200 Full Discounted Price for all three elements £525 To book your place on the course please fill in the attached application form and send it with £50 non refundable deposit to secure your place. Course fees are split into two payment installments 50% payable before the course starts and the remaining 50% by June 21st Other payment plans may be made if necessary so please contact us to discuss this. If current Covid 19 circumstances prevent the workshops from happening at the designated times, please be assured that they will be reinstated at a later date. The course will be completed.

Hidden Worlds

workshops
02:00 Wednesday 19 May 2021

Make a window into a hidden world with art tutor and theatre designer Lucy Dean.

Make a window into a hidden world with art tutor and theatre designer Lucy Dean. Theatrical scenes in a closed box, viewed through a peephole. theatrical self expression in a box! Hidden Worlds - 6 Weeks £60 total/£10 a session Starting Wednesday May 19th 2pm-3.30pm

10:30 Wednesday 19 May 2021

Ashley from Lotus Lessons will support you through a gentle chair based practice that is focused on mindful movement and meditation. Sessions are accessible for all with modifications given where needed. Beginners Yoga - Weekly £10 Thur May 20th 10.30am-11.30am

Open Stage

music
20:00 Wednesday 19 May 2021

Musicians, poets, storytellers, comedians are all welcome! Basically anyone who needs a mic to express their art.

The best open mic in Eastbourne. Free entry and first act from 8pm. All musicians welcome! All poets welcome! All storytellers welcome! All comedians welcome! Ticket MUST be booked in advance. £10 holding deposits for tables. All events are in pre-booked ‘bubbles’ Book your bubbles by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

Holding Space

community
10:00 Thursday 20 May 2021

If you are a parent/carer looking after a child who is struggling with their mental health why not pop in and meet other parents.

If you are a parent/carer looking after a child who is struggling with their mental health why not pop in and meet other parents. Relaxed group offering a safe, confidential space; time to chat, connect and share with one another. Know that you are not alone as a parent. Holding Space is a free Monthly group starting Thursday May 20th 10am-11.30am

Big Al Arcane and the Nightrider

music
20:30 Friday 21 May 2021

Join big Al Arcane and the Nightrider for a COVID Safe performance!

Join big Al Arcane and the Nightrider for a COVID Safe performance! Big Al's musical project is to blend traditional Rhythm 'n Blues with modern styling to create an inclusion that celebrates cultural variety. He enjoys roots music; blues, boogie and the jazz developed from these influences. Tickets £5 All events are in pre-booked ‘bubbles’ Book your bubbles by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

Treble Twenty

theatre
19:45 Saturday 22 May 2021

Printers at the Grove A new play by Scott Kingsnorth

We are thrilled that on our opening weekend we will be presenting a brand new two hander Treble Twenty, a fantastic new PPH production and our first piece of theatre this year. We are also delighted that Script Works Productions are filming it, so that as well as being a COVID secure bubbled live production, it will also be available online! Roy is an old fashioned, red faced bigot of a man with opinions that could make Alf Garnett look prudish. His teammate is Jim, a man who has been biting his tongue for so long that he is in danger of severing it. The only thing these two men have in common is their weekly darts game, as they prepare for the forthcoming Foyle’s Cup tensions begin to mount. Could this be their last game or will someone 180? Written by: Scott Kingsnorth Matthew Devitt - Roy Karl Williamson - Jim Directed by: John Berry Gino Isaacs - Filming Limited tickets available for this Covid secure event so book now. Tickets £14 each Concession available Should this event need to be postponed tickets will be transferable. All events are in pre-booked ‘bubbles’ Book your bubbles by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

Marky Dawson

music
20:30 Friday 28 May 2021

Marky started teaching himself piano at the age of 14. After moving to London, Marky was soon a regular on the circuit working as resident pianist in pubs and bars, entertaining audiences with his wide repertoire of covers and catchy originals.

Marky started teaching himself piano at the age of 14. After moving to London, Marky was soon a regular on the circuit working as resident pianist in pubs and bars, entertaining audiences with his wide repertoire of covers and catchy originals. Playing in his unique style of energetic piano based Rock 'n' Roll, Marky doesn't use backing tracks: it's all live and he's happy to take requests. After all, with a song list covering 7 decades there's a pretty good chance he'll know the song you love! Tickets £5 All events are in pre-booked ‘bubbles’ Book your bubbles by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

Ben Westwood

music
19:00 Saturday 29 May 2021

Singer-songwriter Ben Westwood performs as a duo with multi-instrumentalist Scott Doane, playing a range of acoustic originals and covers that blend folk, blues, rock and soul.

Popular talented singer-songwriter returns to Printers with great original music and top covers in his own style! Ben will be supported by his friend, fellow singer-songwriter Scott Doane. www,facebook.com/benwestwoodmusic www.benwestwoodmusic.com Tickets £5 All events are in pre-booked ‘bubbles’ Book your bubbles by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

Book Club

community
10:30 Wednesday 2 Jun 2021

Join a relaxed group of like minded locals interested in having a natter about a good book!

Join a relaxed group of like minded locals interested in having a natter about a good book! Come along to the first session to discuss what books we enjoy and what we would to read. Books will be chosen by consensus. PPH Book Club is a monthly free group meeting from Wednesday June 2nd 10.30 - 11.30

Happenings

theatre
19:30 Friday 2 Jul 2021

Printers at the Grove A new play by John Berry

In these tough times, Life’s a struggle. There’s unfulfilled expectations. Humdrum existences needing an injection of life. Millions wishing something, would happen to them, to fill the void in their lives. Clearly everyone “else” is happy. Online celebrations and holiday pics prove it. Jane can’t take it anymore. She needs that something, anything! but how far is she willing to go to get it? If you purchased a ticket or tickets for the original run of Happenings at the Grove in December 2020, but were unable to attend on account of being resident in a then-Tier 3 or 4 area, you may exchange your ticket(s) for either of these two performances. Please contact us at grovetheatreeastbourne@gmail.com for your exchange to be processed. This does not apply to those who received refunds on their tickets.

Happenings

theatre
21:00 Saturday 3 Jul 2021

Printers at the Grove A new play by John Berry

In these tough times, Life’s a struggle. There’s unfulfilled expectations. Humdrum existences needing an injection of life. Millions wishing something, would happen to them, to fill the void in their lives. Clearly everyone “else” is happy. Online celebrations and holiday pics prove it. Jane can’t take it anymore.
